definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air

sentences.english: no one else can see you shake your head.
I shook my head reprovingly, and then she blushed and whispered.
sentences.chinese: 我不以为然地摇摇头，于是她脸红了，小声说。

sentences.english: She shook her head and then started laughing and running again.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇头，笑了起来，然后又开始跑。

sentences.english: The young American pilot bit his lip, shaking his head.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻的美国机师咬住了嘴唇，摇了摇头。

sentences.english: Deborah shook her head, tears in her own eyes.
sentences.chinese: 德博拉摇摇头，眼里满是泪水。

sentences.english: He examined the old knight and shook his head sadly.
sentences.chinese: 诊察了这位老武士之后，伤心地摇摇头。

sentences.english: The fellow shook his head irritably.
sentences.chinese: 那个家伙不耐烦地摇了摇头。

sentences.english: If you don't like the Penguins, you might be shaking your head in dismay .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不喜欢企鹅队，你有可能会摇头叹息。

sentences.english: I shake the head, afterwards then the corona arrived, only hears an alarm signal sound.
sentences.chinese: 我摇头，之后便晕到了，只听到一阵警号声。

sentences.english: Senators Kennedy and Packwood shake their heads when they walk past you.
sentences.chinese: 参议员肯尼迪和伍德路过你时，摇摇头。

sentences.english: Talking with them are tedious so I can't help shaking head and sighing.
sentences.chinese: 跟这些人谈话真是索然无味，因此才摇头叹息。

sentences.english: My neighbors and I shook our heads and fumed.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们和我一样，愤怒地摇头，却无可奈何。

sentences.english: He carried the newspaper back out to the kitchen and shook the hair clippings into the trash can.
sentences.chinese: 他把报纸回厨房，然后摇了摇头发剪报进了垃圾桶。

sentences.english: The two brothers shook their heads and smiled at each other.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟俩摇摇头，彼此相觑笑了。

sentences.english: I shook my head, thinking he must have me confused with a dog.
sentences.chinese: 我摇摇头，想他肯定把我和狗混淆了。

definition: to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to have heard what was said
first time/first (round, course, coat of paint etc)
tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
